revised_title: Observations of Nebulous Stars and the Star in the Neck of the Whale
tldr: In 1666, Monsieur Bullialdus observed the Nebulosa star in the Andromeda galaxy and the wondrous star in the Neck of the Whale. He reported that the Nebulosa star appeared to grow brighter and larger over time. The observations were made difficult by cloudy weather and the brightness of the stars. Bullialdus also mentioned receiving a letter from Hevelius, who had a different hypothesis about these stars.
